lead_paragraph: The California Legislature has asked the State Supreme Court to throw out a constitutional amendment that limits the number of years politicians may hold statewide office. In a lawsuit filed on Thursday, the Legislature asserted that the manner in which the amendment was adopted violated the California Constitution. The amendment reached the ballot through a voter signature drive. Listed on the ballot as Proposition 140, it was approved by 52 percent of the voters in a referendum last November.

headline.main: California Legislature Challenges Ballot Measure Limiting Terms
